contentrichtext.text: [[Image:Kennedy Development Road.jpg|thumb|The Kennedy Development Road between Middleton and [[Boulia, Queensland|Boulia]], 2011]] The '''Outback Highway''' or '''Outback Way''' is a series of roads and dirt tracks linking [[Winton, Queensland]] and [[Laverton, Western Australia]]. At {{convert|2800|km|0|abbr=on}}, it crosses [[Central Australia]] (colloquially known as the [[Outback]]), passing through [[Queensland]], the [[Northern Territory]] and [[Western Australia]]. It has been proposed as a development to provide an inland route between southern Western Australia and northern Queensland as an alternative to the [[Highway 1 (Australia)|National Highway 1]] along either coast.<ref>BSD Consultants.(1998) Outback Highway feasibility study : final report / prepared for Main Roads Western Australia, Northern Territory Department of Transport and Works, and Main Roads Queensland ; prepared by BSD Consultants Pty. Ltd. Subiaco, WA "March 1998"</ref> Roads that make up the highway are: *[[Great Central Road]] *[[Gunbarrel Highway]] *[[Lasseter Highway]] *[[Stuart Highway]] *[[Plenty Highway]] *[[Donohue Highway]] *[[Kennedy Development Road]] Support for the project is strong amongst local government areas along the route and elsewhere.<ref name="cboh">{{Cite news |url=http://www.abc.net.au/news/2011-06-23/councils-back-outback-highway-push/2768626 |title=Councils back outback highway push |accessdate=25 August 2011 |date=23 June 2011 |work=ABC News |publisher=Australian Broadcasting Corporation }}</ref> Federal funding of A$70 million over 10 years would be required. ==See also== {{Portal|Australia}} *[[Highways in Australia]] *[[List of highways in the Northern Territory]] *[[List of highways in Queensland]] *[[List of highways in Western Australia]] ==Notes== {{reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.outbackway.org.au/ Outback Highway official website] {{Road infrastructure in Queensland}} [[Category:Highways in Australia]]
